intro: Espeletiopsis × meridensis, commonly known as the hybrid orchid, is a rare and unique plant species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, showy flowers that often display a blend of colors. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in moist, shaded conditions. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a hybrid, showcasing genetic diversity within the genus Espeletiopsis. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
